result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 30 days

10:05 AM Defendant Brian Damien Johnston appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Brian Damien Johnston.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with no special conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with no special conditions.
**Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 30 days 

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.
Status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
